channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Half-mended potholes #3, 18th February
item.description:
These were mended a few months back I think but are all opening up again. Cars are swerving to avoid the very poor road surface in several places down Leckhampton Hill and this is going to cause an accident.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Leckhampton Hill, Ullenwood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose manhole cover, 17th February
item.description:
Large manhole cover is a loose fit so that when a vehicle travels over the manhole it bangs. During the day and particularly at night this can be heard several streets away. Magnitude of bang sound seems to be getting louder over the last 3 months suggesting the man hole cover is getting looser still.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 3 Ryeworth Road, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Part blocked pathway, 17th February
item.description:
Tree fallen. Road cleared but Foot pathway blocked

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Evesham Road, Prestbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large and deep potholes outside 246 Innsworth lane, 17th February
item.description:
The potholes outside 246 Innsworth lane are becoming larger and large. There has now been more instances of school children falling off the bicycles and old people struggling with their motorised mobility chairs/scooters

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 252 Innsworth Lane, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pair of potholes on Tennyson Road near mini roundabout, 16th February

item.title: Pothole on Tennyson Road just on approach to roundabout, 16th February
item.description:
The road is opened up between the two patches of repairs, it is more than 7 1/2 cm deep, and it is directly in the path of cyclists approaching the roundabout safely. Please fix urgently

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Brooklyn Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lamposts not working, 15th February
item.description:
Lamp posts 3738, 3739 and 3740 arenâ€™t working and is making it really difficult when joining the road from the roundabout. 3 other lots are also not working. This has been the case for at least the last 3 weeks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A417, Hucclecote

item.title: Broken glass on pavement, 15th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 17 Hatherley Court Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poor and illegal parking, 15th February
item.description:
Person parked and fully blocking pavement where double yellow lines exist. When asked to move so I could safely pass she declined telling me I am selfish. I pointed out the P&R across the road and was shouted at. As I passed on the very wet verge I slipped and nearly injured myself on her car. This is a violation of parking laws as there are double yellow lines in this location.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Fiddler's Green Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Complete mess at rear of properties on Lloyd Close, 15th February
item.description:
Abysmal litter / bins mess

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 20a Lloyd Close, Cheltenham
